events.message: The applicant completed the personal loan application online, requesting funds to cover medical expenses and outstanding credit card debt.
Loan type categorization was completed; the application was identified as a personal loan due to keywords like medical and debt.
A loan officer was assigned to handle the case and began initial communication with the applicant to clarify the loan purpose.
The loan officer conducted the initial review by verifying the completeness of the submitted information and checking eligibility criteria.
Additional documentation was requested from the applicant, including recent pay stubs and medical bills to validate the reasons for the loan.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested documents, including income statements and detailed medical invoices.
A credit check was conducted which showed a moderate credit score with some recent credit utilization, posing some minor concerns.
Risk assessment was completed evaluating the applicant's credit history, repayment capacity, and medical financial burden.
A loan offer with a moderate interest rate and flexible repayment plan was presented to the applicant based on their assessment.
The applicant responded positively to the offer and requested clarification on some of the repayment terms before final acceptance.
The loan case was escalated to the senior underwriter for final approval review due to the combined factors in the application.
The loan was formally approved after thorough evaluation, confirming all requirements and mitigating identified risks.
Loan funds were disbursed to the applicant's bank account to assist with medical payments and debt consolidation as requested.
A follow-up call was conducted to ensure the applicant was satisfied with the loan disbursement and address any upcoming questions.
The loan application case was officially closed with all necessary documentation filed and the applicant informed of next steps.
